intro: Ageratina triangulata, commonly known as the triangular ageratum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fluffy blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil. Ageratina triangulata is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
